abstract: Powerful Republicans are bent on letting the export credit agency die, imperiling overseas projects and sales by American companies.
snippet: Powerful Republicans are bent on letting the export credit agency die, imperiling overseas projects and sales by American companies.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In 2013, the impoverished African nation Cameroon teamed with General Electric and the Environmental Chemical Corporation, which is based in Burlingame, Calif., to begin work on a $668 million drinking water project for its thirsty capital, financed with loan guarantees from the Export-Import Bank of the United States.

headline.main: Export-Import Bank Near Showdown in Congress
headline.print_headline: Threat to U.S. Export-Import Bank Imperils a Water Project in Cameroon
